column4: I have a toshiba satellite with a bios so horrible it can do _nothing_ but boot directly from the boot partition
I took the HDD out, hooked it up to my other laptop via usb, and I'm running off of it right now
I need to force it to use VESA, how do I do this?
can gparted install grub on specific partitions?
it's the most horrible bios in the history of man
it's a bios from HELL.
no wait, that'll make 'open' just run one app...
I don't know how to do that.....
how do I make it use VESA?
lots of them are. Manufacturers also cripple bioses to reduce misconfiguration and hence support calls...
that's what I figure happened
I see crippled bioses on HPs a lot...
try gogeta's suggestion...
if the bios ignores the mbr, how does it boot *anything*?
gogeta: right, see Jordan_U's message above about broken bioses...
what message?

....There are some *extremely* broken BIOSs that actually look for the boot flag in the partition table and chainload that partition, which is what Microsoft's MBR code does, rather than executing the MBR itself.... -- Jordan_U
exactly what's going on here
I've never saved such a change from grub. I thought it was temporary only good for that particular bootup...
I don't even see any effect in the same booting up
you have to make the edit, hit return, and then boot it immediately using 'b'... (this is from memory. I use it when I want a single user boot instead of keeping special grub entries)
